result.execSummary:
The defendant Moises Melendez-Roman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court ordered that all MANDATORY court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid due no later than 4-19-2024.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with 22CF334, with credit for 87 DAYS served..
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction; Concurrent with 22CF334, with credit for 87 DAYS served.  

The Court ordered that all MANDATORY court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid due no later than 4-19-2024.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Moises Melendez-Roman in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Moises Melendez-Roman in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and upon motion of the state, the Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED AND READ IN for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by the parties to criminal complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint. Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing. 

Filed: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions/Elements of the Offense

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Moises Melendez-Roman not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Moises Melendez-Roman in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Moises Melendez-Roman in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Moises Melendez-Roman appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart Supercenter, 6701 South 27th Street, City of Franklin, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin 53132
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Moises Melendez-Roman in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Moises Melendez-Roman in custody.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Moises Melendez-Roman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 1.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
